title: Stage set for Asian Rugby Sevens in Colombo
byline: After an eight-year gap top-class rugby action returns to Sri Lanka as the Asia Rugby Emirates Sevens Series 2025 makes its much-anticipated kick off in Colombo in the form of the second leg of the tournament on October 18 and 19 at the Race Course Ground.

title: New Zealand get on the board with battling Bangladesh win
byline: New Zealand were made to work for their first ICC Women’s Cricket World Cup 2025 win with a 100-run triumph over Bangladesh.

title: Ben Sulayem set to stand unopposed in FIA election
byline: Incumbent Mohammed Ben Sulayem is poised to stand unopposed in December’s election for the presidency of motorsport’s governing body, the FIA.

title: England wary of Sri Lanka challenge in Colombo
byline: As England look to climb to the top of the Cricket World Cup table, they face an eager Sri Lanka who have the ingredients for a tournament upset.

title: Government’s budgetary implementation slower than usual - World Bank report
byline: The government’s implementation of the budgeted amounts remained unusually slow during the first seven months of the year, a decline of 19.8 per cent compared to the corresponding period of last year, according to a World Bank report.

title: Rains and strong winds forecasted in Sri Lanka’s sea areas
byline: The Department of Meteorology has forecasted showers or thundershowers in the sea areas off the coast from Colombo to Pottuvil, via Galle and Hambantota. Isolated showers or thundershowers may also occur in other surrounding sea areas during the evening or night today.

title: Sri Lanka’s first AI-powered hotel inaugurated
byline: Minister of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment and Tourism Vijitha Herath attended the inauguration of the Grand Serendib Colombo, Sri Lanka’s first AI-powered hotel project, held last night (10) at the Shangri-La Hotel, Colombo.

title: President honours injured officers with promotions to Major General rank
byline: The Commander of the Armed Forces and President, Anura Kumara Dissanayake, has approved the promotion of five Brigadiers to the rank of Major General in recognition of their distinguished service, coinciding with the 76th Army Day celebrated on October 10, 2025.

title: Trump threatens to impose additional 100% tariff on China
byline: US President Donald Trump has said he would impose an additional 100% tariff on imports from China from next month.

title: Final decision on electricity tariff revision on October 14: PUCSL
byline: The Public Utilities Commission of Sri Lanka (PUCSL) has announced that its final decision regarding the proposed electricity tariff revision will be released on Tuesday, October 14.

title: Sri Lanka eyes skill-driven economy to future-proof growth
byline: Sri Lanka is ramping up efforts to bridge its widening skill gap as the policymakers and industry leaders warned that the country’s future competitiveness hinges on developing a workforce equipped for rapid technological and structural change.

title: Government’s plan to transfer Police Commission powers to IGP backtracked: Opposition
byline: The government’s plan to transfer powers from the National Police Commission to the Inspector General of Police (IGP) is being backtracked following objections raised in Parliament, several opposition MPs claimed yesterday.

title: Never said will execute MR: SF
byline: Former MP Field Marshal Sarath Fonseka said today that he never had any intention of executing former President Mahinda Rajapaksa, though some have misunderstood his recent  remarks in Matara.

title: Adults must open paths for children’s progress- PM
byline: The children of the country possess the strength, ability, and attitude required to build the nation, and it is the responsibility of adults to open the paths for them to move forward, said Prime Minister and Minister of Education, Higher Education, and Vocational Education Dr. Harini Amarasuriya.

title: College of Oncologists raises concerns over cancer ‘miracle drug’
byline: The Sri Lanka College of Oncologists (SLCO) has raised serious concerns over a “cancer cure” said to have been developed by a research team from the University of Colombo, warning that the product lacks credible scientific evidence and could endanger vulnerable patients.

title: John Keells CG Auto urges expedited release of detained BYD vehicles
byline: John Keells CG Auto (Pvt) Ltd, the authorised distributor of BYD vehicles in Sri Lanka, yesterday emphasised the necessity of expediting the release of BYD vehicles detained by the Sri Lanka Customs (SLC).

title: Mlaba reprimanded for breaching ICC Code of Conduct
byline: South Africa spinner Nonkululeko Mlaba has been reprimanded for breaching Level 1 of the ICC Code of Conduct during the ICC Women’s Cricket World Cup league match against India on Thursday.

title: Bimal Rathnayake’s media secretary resigns over disappointment
byline: Media Secretary to the Ministry of Transport,  Highways and Urban Development Suranga Lakmal Senevirathne has reportedly stepped down from office citing inability to work with subject Minister Bimal Rathnayake.

title: Proposal to set up National Education Council to be presented to Cabinet soon: Deputy Minister
byline: A proposal to set up a National Education Council is to be presented to the Cabinet soon, Deputy Minister Mahinda Jayasinghe said today.

title: Sri Lanka getting warmer due to climate change: World Bank report
byline: Sri Lanka’s climate is warming rapidly, with temperature increases of 0.95°- 1.14°C expected by 2040, the World Bank said yesterday.

title: All Opposition political parties to hold massive rally in Nugegoda next month
byline: All Opposition political parties have decided to hold a massive rally in Nugegoda next month, UNP Chairman Wajira Abeywardena said today.

title: 50 visitors fined for violating rules at Horton Plains National Park
byline: During the past week, authorities at Horton Plains National Park have issued spot fines to 50 individuals for violating park regulations, Park Warden Sisira Rathnayake said.

title: If we are not allowed to express ourselves, shut down parliament: MP Chamara Sampath
byline: “If we are not allowed to express ourselves here, then it’s better to shut down this House,” Opposition MP Chamara Sampath Dassanayake told Parliament yesterday, defending his right to speak after a complaint was lodged against him with the Criminal Investigation Department (CID).

title: Sri Lanka face daunting task against England bowlers
byline: Sri Lanka will face a daunting task to beat England in their Women’s Cricket World Cup match at the Premadasa Stadium in Colombo today as the tournament was thrown open on Thursday when South Africa caused a shock result

title: Venezuelan opposition leader María Corina Machado wins Nobel Peace Prize
byline: Venezuela’s opposition leader María Corina Machado has been awarded the 2025 Nobel Peace Prize.

title: Police launch probe into Mount Lavinia Court assault incident
byline: Police have launched an investigation into an incident at the Mount Lavinia Magistrate’s Court premises in which a lawyer was allegedly assaulted by a police officer.

title: Four killed in mass shooting after Mississippi football game
byline: Four people have been killed and 12 others injured, four critically, after a mass shooting in the US state of Mississippi.

title: Sri Lanka dealt big injury scare against England in CWC25
byline: The tournament co-hosts had to contend with skipper Chamari Athapaththu being forced off the pitch against England in the ICC Women’s Cricket World Cup.

title: Djokovic loses to qualifier in Shanghai last four
byline: An injury-hit Novak Djokovic suffered a shock defeat by Monegasque qualifier Valentin Vacherot in the semi-finals of the Shanghai Masters.
